| HistoryText             = The '''Black Tide''', originally known as the '''Swift Tide''', were a team of Atlantean warrior women who had fought to overcome the sexism of Atlantean society and attained celebrity status across the undersea world for their skill and combat prowess. With members from [[Atlantis (Kingdom)|Imperial Atlantis]], the [[Skarka Tribe (Earth-616)|Chasm People]], and other undersea civilizations, the Swift Tide embodied hope of cooperation and peaceful relations between the rival groups, and defended all of the sea peoples that lived in peace.<!--{{r|King in Black: Namor #1}}-->

In the 1930s, the Swift Tide discovered the location of the evil relic known as the [[Unforgotten Stone]],{{r|King in Black: Namor #1}} a stone prison containing the evil power, if not the very souls, of the [[Great Old Ones]],{{r|King in Black: Namor #2}} and brought word of it to a diplomatic meeting between the Chasm People and Atlantis, helping fend off an assassination attempt on the political leaders and government officials by Chasm People rebels. [[Attukar (Earth-616)|King Attukar]] of the Chasm People and [[Krang (Earth-616)|Warlord Krang]] of the Atlantean Empire decided to send the Swift Tide on a mission to retrieve and dispose of the Unforgotten Stone before it could be discovered by [[Homo sapiens|humans]]; and assigned Prince [[Namor McKenzie (Earth-616)|Namor]] of the Atlantean Empire and Prince [[Attuma (Earth-616)|Attuma]] of the Chasm People to accompany them hoping to encourage a friendship between the two princes and thereby ease political tensions between their peoples.{{r|King in Black: Namor #1}}

The expedition uncovered that the Unforgotten Stone had been stolen by Soviet scientists and the [[Thule Society (Earth-616)|Thule Society]], who unwittingly activated it. Engulfed by its eldritch power, the Swift Tide were corrupted and fused with their mounts to become predatory monsters resembling [[Fishmen|Deep Ones]].{{r|King in Black #2}} Renaming themselves the Black Tide, they slaughtered the Chasm People present at the the diplomatic meeting - including King Attukar - and rampaged until they were subdued and exiled to the depths of the [[Mariana Trench]],{{r|King in Black: Namor #1}}{{r|King in Black: Namor Vol 1 3}} where they lay dormant until approached by Namor, who sought to recruit them to fend off [[Knull (Earth-616)|Knull]]'s invasion of [[Earth]].{{r|King in Black #2}}

As Namor had feared, following Knull's defeat the Black Tide refused to return to exile and disappeared, leading to Namor's [[Defenders of the Deep (Earth-616)|Defenders of the Deep]] hunting them down.{{r|King in Black: Namor #3}}

| Equipment               = 
| Transportation          = Each of the members of the Swift Tide had a personalized mount. The Unforgotten Stone merged each of them with their mounts - replacing Kharsa's legs with sharklike fins, Sycorax's lower body with tentacles, Sweet Mercy's limbs with blades, and Garanna's lower body with that of her ray.{{r|King in Black: Namor Vol 1 3}}
| Weapons                 = [[Kharsa (Earth-616)|Captain Kharsa]]'s sword, [[Sycorax (Earth-616)|Sycorax]]'s magic, [[Garanna (Earth-616)|Garanna]]'s club; claws and fangs as the Black Tide. As a member of the Black Tide, the Mountain was turned into a creature comprised of living lava.{{r|King in Black: Namor Vol 1 3}}
